title: The life cycle of Indian Agriculture so far! Let's get you through it

tasks.task: Analyzing the history and current practices of Indian agriculture
subtasks: Identify the role of the Indus Valley civilization in agricultural development
Describe traditional plowing techniques mentioned in the Rig Veda
List crops cultivated in ancient India, such as rice, cotton, and millets
Explain the plowing patterns and tools used in ancient times (e.g., use of oxen, wooden crosspieces)
Discuss the introduction and spread of sugarcane cultivation in India
Note the importance of irrigation and varied cropping seasons (ruby, kharif, zine)
Differentiate between subsistence and commercial farming in present-day India
Explain the concept of shifting cultivation (slash and burn) and its practice in modern times
Compare intensive and extensive commercial farming
Address the challenges in adopting new agricultural technologies

tasks.task: Discuss the economic factors affecting Indian farmers
subtasks: Highlight the literacy rates (45% for women, 26% for men) and its impact on agricultural knowledge
Mention government policies and incentives (support prices, subsidies) for farmers
Discuss the role of soil testing and its associated costs

tasks.task: Examine the future of Indian agriculture
subtasks: Reflect on the benefits of sustainable and organic farming
Mention the growth of the organic food market (current and projected)
Discuss the potential for smallholder farmers in the organic sector
